question: Which of the following is the language from which "Guyanese Creole" is derived?
explanation: English is the language from which "Guyanese Creole" is derived. Guyanese Creole is an English-based creole language spoken by people in Guyana. Linguistically, it is similar to other English dialects of the Caribbean region, based on 19th-century English and has loan words from African, Indian, Arawakan and older Dutch languages.
